subject: Science
title: Floods: When Water Takes Over
description: A micro-lesson that makes Floods: When Water Takes Over usable.

hook.text: Floods are the most common natural disaster on Earth â€” and the most destructive.

buildup.text: Heavy rain overwhelms rivers and drainage. Water rises faster than it can escape.

discovery.text: Flash floods can turn a dry creek into a raging river in under an hour.

twist.text: Most flood deaths happen in cars. People drive into water that looks shallow.

climax.text: Just 15 cm of fast-moving water can knock you off your feet. 60 cm can carry a car.

punchline.text: Turn around, don't drown. Six inches of moving water can kill you.

quiz.question: Where do most flood deaths occur?
